pr_title: Off-heap timestamp cache and persistent storage integration

timeline.message: Change config and add more info.

timeline.bodyText:
Some notes:

should we validate that the path is an absolute path?
it feels this method should be private, unless I'm missing something.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: I would include as Args the start timestamp and commit timestamps reported by each of the services in this case, for easier debugging.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe readThenAbortStillCaches...? A ReadTransaction is something else, and could lead to confusion
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: In general throughout this class, is isNotNull() really needed? I imagine the isEqualTo check should be good enough. Transaction#getTimestamp returns a primitive long, so non-null.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: Might be cleaner in terms of minimum visibility to just return the timestamp from the transaction task.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: I think we should test the logic in this class in this PR, especially since it's on a live path
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: I would Preconditions.checkState this for readability (instead of the class cast exception you'd get if we ship a bug here)
